alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:31PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oklahoma, northwestern Lincoln, southeastern Logan and southwestern Payne Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Oklahoma City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Oklahoma City, Edmond, Perkins, Jones, Langston, Luther, Carney, Tryon, Coyle, Arcadia, Meridian and Fallis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 138 and 141. Interstate 44 between mile markers 136 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
